c74object.name: crow.var
c74object.digest: Assign values to a variable on the crow.
c74object.description: Specify a variable to address as crow.var's first argument. Connect the output of crow.var to the input of the crow object. Values sent to crow.var will be sent to the crow eurorack module and stored in the specified variable.

objarg.name: variable
objarg.description: Values sent to crow.var's left inlet will be sent to crow and stored in this variable.

method.name: int
method.description: An integer sent to the left inlet will be stored in the specified variable.

method.name: float
method.description: A float sent to the left inlet will be stored in the specified variable.

method.name: symbol
method.description: A symbol sent to the left inlet will be converted to a string and stored in the specified variable.

method.name: var
method.digest: Store a variable in the the variable addressed by crow.var.
method.description: The word var followed by a valid variable name stores the name of that variable in crow.var's current variable. For instance, if crow.var is set to input[1].change, then sending var myFunction to crow.var's first inlet would be equivalent to executing the Lua code input[1].change = myFunction.

method.name: table
method.digest: Overwrite the variable addressed by crow.var with an empty table.
method.description: The word table, when sent to crow.var's first inlet, will overwrite crow.var's specified variable with an empty table (i.e. myVar = { }).

method.name: index
method.digest: Assign a value to an integer index in the table specified by crow.var's variable.
method.description:
The word index followed by an integer index and any value, when sent to crow.var's first inlet, will write the value to the specified index in the table assigned to crow.var's variable. For instance, if crow.var is set to myTable, then index 6 2.4 is equivalent to the Lua chunk myTable[6] = 2.4.
NB: symbols are treated as variable names; symbols must be wrapped in single quotes to be treated as strings.

method.name: keyval
method.digest: Assign a value to a key in the table specified by crow.var's variable.
method.description:
The word keyval followed by a key and a value, when sent to crow.var's first inlet, will write the value to the specified key in the table assigned to crow.var's variable. For instance, if crow.var is set to myTable, then keyval someKey 2.4 is equivalent to the Lua chunk myTable.someKey = 2.4.
NB: symbols are treated as variable names; symbols must be wrapped in single quotes to be treated as strings.
